{{Refimprove|date=April 2008}} '''Nudity in American television''' has always been a controversial topic. Aside from a few exceptions, [[nudity]] in the [[United States]] has traditionally not been shown on [[terrestrial television]]. On the other hand, [[cable television]] has been much less constrained as far as nudity is concerned.
==History== The [[Public Broadcasting Service]], which features nudity in anthropological documentaries as well as some films, was the first network to display national programming that featured frontal female nudity on television. In 1975<ref>[https://archive.org/details/mantheincrediblemachine ''Man: The Incredible Machine'', in archive.org]</ref> (with a rerun in 1986<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0073164/|title="National Geographic Specials" Man: The Incredible Machine|work=IMDb|accessdate=8 November 2016}}</ref>), the PBS ''[[National Geographic (magazine)|National Geographic]]'' special ''[[Man: The Incredible Machine]]'' looked into parts of the human body and included in its opening scenes a fully nude woman in an [[Model (art)|artist's model]] pose; probably less for this than the innovative [[microcinematography|micro-]] and interior cinematography, this was for more than half a decade the most popular single program broadcast on the network.
The special-event miniseries, ''[[Roots (1977 miniseries)|Roots]]'' on [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]], featured some partial nudity of its cast, usually fleetingly, but more so than other commercial network programming in the US in the 1970s.
Throughout the United States, many metropolitan areas had [[independent television station]]s that were not affiliated with any of the national networks and showed programming only to people within their limited broadcast range. During the 1980s, many of these stations experimented with content containing frontal female nudity in movies during [[prime time]]. [[KTLA]] in Los Angeles, for example, showed an unedited version of the [[Academy Award]]-winning ''[[One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest (film)|One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest]]'', which featured fully exposed female breasts, between 7:30 and 11 p.m. The channel began the time slot with a video of director [[Miloš Forman]] stating that the film was too controversial to be allowed a faithful television broadcast (NBC's earlier broadcast had cut the film to fit the two hours format with commercials), but that KTLA believed that the culture had changed such that a complete broadcast would be tolerated and appreciated. Then, it was followed by a disclaimer that was repeated after each [[commercial break]].
[[KTVU]] in the [[San Francisco Bay Area]] regularly showed uncensored films that contained nudity, such as ''[[Magnum Force]]'' (1973, with uncredited [[Suzanne Somers]] appearing topless in a pool scene), ''[[Big Bad Mama]]'' (1974, with [[Angie Dickinson]] and [[William Shatner]]), and ''[[Walkabout (film)|Walkabout]]'' (1971, which contained full frontal nudity in a [[nude swimming|nude bathing]] scene with then–teenage actress [[Jenny Agutter]]).
A number of stations in this era even went so far as to run promotions during which they would show a series of movies known for nudity in an attempt to get higher ratings for the week. In almost all cases, the nudity was restricted to showing exposed buttocks and female breasts.
By the end of the 1980s, most of these stations had started to receive complaints about such nudity and these broadcasts eventually stopped. In addition, some of these stations became [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] affiliates and were no longer able to make independent programming decisions during prime time.
From the early 1990s until the early 2000s, some prime time series (such as [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]'s ''[[NYPD Blue]]'' and ''[[Once and Again]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0106079/trivia|title=NYPD Blue (TV Series 1993–2005)|work=IMDb|accessdate=23 May 2016}}</ref> [[CBS]]'s ''[[Chicago Hope]]'' <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0108724/trivia|title=Chicago Hope (TV Series 1994–2000)|work=IMDb|accessdate=23 May 2016}}</ref> and [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]]'s ''[[John Doe (TV series)|John Doe]]'') experimented with nudity. ''NYPD Blue'' is noteworthy for featuring nudity in the context of people engaging in sexual activity. While fully exposed female breasts were never shown, the show often depicted full back nudity of men and women.
In 1997, [[NBC]] broadcast an unedited version of [[Steven Spielberg]]'s [[Holocaust]] film ''[[Schindler's List]]'' in prime time. The film features brief full-frontal nudity of both sexes in non-sexual contexts. Then-Congressman [[Tom Coburn]] criticized NBC's airing of the film for its nudity, violence and profanity. Both Democrats and Coburn's fellow Republicans criticized Coburn for his reaction, and defended the film and NBC's choice to air it in full. Coburn subsequently apologized for his reaction.<ref>[http://www.cnn.com/US/9702/26/schindler.debate/ "After rebuke, congressman apologizes for 'Schindler's List' remarks"], CNN.com, February 26, 1997. Accessed April 05, 2008.</ref>
==Current status== After [[Justin Timberlake]] exposed [[Janet Jackson]]'s breast during a live performance at the [[Super Bowl XXXVIII halftime show controversy|2004 Super Bowl halftime show]], a [[moral panic]] occurred, and the [[Federal Communications Commission]] (FCC) tightened its indecency rules due to public pressure.
As a consequence of the public and media reaction to the incident, major networks edited some of their shows. [[CBS]] removed a shot of a naked man from ''[[Without a Trace]]'', while [[NBC]] deleted a two-second shot of an elderly woman's breast from ''[[ER (TV series)|ER]]''.<ref>[http://www.asiamedia.ucla.edu/article-us.asp?parentid=7685 "American TV pushes nudity off the schedule"], ''[[Taipei Times]]'', February 16, 2004</ref> Subsequently, prime time television networks became more reluctant to show even non-explicit nudity in their TV shows. In the current climate, nudity is almost unknown on any [[broadcast television]] show — with the exception being [[animated series]] such as ''[[The Simpsons]]'' and ''[[Family Guy]]'' (which spoofed the conservative phase of American television in the episode "[[PTV (Family Guy)|PTV]]").
Cable television, on the other hand, is not bound by FCC rules and can show whatever material their executives consider suitable. With some exceptions, while cable channels that rely on advertising still do not show nudity during prime time, nudity is often shown on [[premium cable]] channels such as [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]], [[HBO]] and [[Turner Classic Movies]] (TCM). [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] is one of the few commercial–dependent cable channels that features nudity in its programming (notably the controversial ''[[Nip/Tuck]]'' and [[American Horror Story]]). [[SundanceTV]] will allow nudity. [[Discovery Channel|Discovery]] and other [[Documentary film|documentary]]-related channels may show nudity in a journalistic context, such as that of [[indigenous peoples]].
''[[Dating Naked]]'' is an American [[reality TV|reality series]] [[dating game show]] shown on [[VH1]]. Modelled on Dutch show ''[[Adam Zkt. Eva]]'', the series debuted in July 2014, and ran through 2016.<ref>{{cite web |author=Black, Elizabeth |title=Dating Naked Gets The Greenlight For Season Three! |url=http://www.vh1.com/news/205761/dating-naked-gets-the-greenlight-for-season-three/ |work=[[VH1]] |date=September 14, 2015 |accessdate=September 14, 2015}}</ref> The show matches up heterosexual contestants who are nude most of the time. The genitals of all participants along with the female breasts, and occasionally the buttocks, are blurred out. ''[[Naked and Afraid]]'' is an American reality series shown on the [[Discovery Channel]]. The fifth season premiered on March 13, 2016.<ref>{{cite web|last=Bonin|first=Liane|title=Discovery reveals even more with bare pairs on 'Naked & Afraid'|url=http://www.hitfix.com/starr-raving/discovery-reveals-even-more-with-bare-pairs-on-naked-afraid|work=HitFix|accessdate=July 6, 2013|date=May 28, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Bibel|first=Sara|title='Naked & Afraid' to Premiere Sunday, June 23 on Discovery|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/05/28/naked-afraid-to-premiere-sunday-june-23-on-discovery/184514/|work=[[TV by the Numbers]]|accessdate=July 6, 2013|date=May 28, 2013}}</ref> Each episode chronicles the lives of two [[survivalists]] (one female, one male) who meet for the first time and are given the task of surviving a stay in the wilderness naked for 21 days.<ref>{{cite web|last=Kurp|first=Josh|title=‘Naked And Afraid’ Star Explains How She Caught Fish With Her ‘Private Parts’|url=http://www.uproxx.com/tv/2013/04/naked-and-afraid-star-explains-how-she-caught-fish-with-her-private-parts/|work=UPROXX|accessdate=July 6, 2013|date=April 7, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Kaplan|first=Don|title=Discovery Channel bares all with upcoming 'Naked' shows|url=https://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/discovery-bares-new-naked-shows-article-1.1308199|work=[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]|accessdate=July 6, 2013|date=April 5, 2013}}</ref> Again, the contestants' crotch area and the women's breasts are blurred out.
While nudity practically disappeared from network television, a [[Kaiser Family Foundation]] study of sex on television released in November 2005 showed that TV characters are having sex twice as often as they were in 1998. The study examined more than 1,000 hours of programming.
In recent years, a number of cable stations in the United States have begun to air R-rated movies uncensored. They include ''[[Deadpool (film)|Deadpool]]'' and ''[[The Wolf of Wall Street]]'' airing on FX.
==See also== * [[Depictions of nudity]] * [[Nudity and sexuality]] * [[Nudity in film]] * [[Nudity in music videos]] * [[Sex in advertising]] * [[Sex in film]] * [[Sex and sexuality in speculative fiction]] * [[Super Bowl XXXVIII halftime show controversy]] * [[Wardrobe malfunction]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.asiamedia.ucla.edu/article-us.asp?parentid=7685 "American TV pushes nudity off the schedule"], ''[[Taipei Times]]'', February 16, 2004 * [http://www.tvacres.com/sex_nudity.htm Nudity on television] ([[TV Acres]]) * [http://articles.dhwritings.com/k12.html "Nudity on Broadcast Television"] * Randy Cassingham's ''[[This is True]]'': [http://www.janetjacksonflash.com/ "Super Bowl Bodice Ripper"]
{{nudity}}
[[Category:Nudity in the United States|Television]] [[Category:Television in the United States]]

{{unreferenced|date=September 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2012}} {{Infobox television | show_name = QI News | image = QI News.png | image_alt = | caption = | genre = | creator = [[Justin Gayner]]
[[Robert Meakin]]
[[John Lloyd (writer)|John Lloyd]] | based_on = | developer = | writer = | director = | creative_director = | presenter = | starring = Glenn Wrage
Katherine Jakeways
Robert Meakin
Alexander McConnell (Voice only) | judges = | voices = | narrated = | theme_music_composer = | opentheme = | endtheme = | composer = | country = United Kingdom | language = | num_seasons = | num_episodes = 4 | list_episodes = | executive_producer = | producer = | editor = | cinematography = | camera = | runtime = 5 minutes | company = | distributor = | network = ComedyBox.tv | picture_format = | audio_format = | first_aired = 17 September 2007 | last_aired = present | related = | website = | production_website = }} '''''QI News''''' was an [[internet television]] show produced by ''Quite Interesting Limited'', the company which produces the British [[panel game]] ''[[QI]]''. It was broadcast on [[ComedyBox.tv]]. It was a mock news programme, which instead of broadcasting news stories, broadcast "quite interesting" stories. Other than the stories, the show also played on the characters in it, mainly the two news readers. ==Show== ''QI News'' was a five-minute long show which reported "quite interesting" things from around the world. It was presented by two newsreaders, brash American Bob Squire ([[Glenn Wrage]]) and female Cambridge British co-anchor Sophie Langton ([[Katherine Jakeways]]). Other contributions were sometimes provided by correspondent Graham Prince ([[Robert Meakin]]). Off-screen, the Producer (Voice of [[Alexander McConnell (producer)|Alexander McConnell]]) tried to keep Squire and Langton in order. Each programme ended with one of the characters mentioning a final fact. The other would say, "Is that news?" to which the first responded, "It's news to me". As the credits roll, a disclaimer appeared which read, "All the information in this programme is believed to be true", followed by humorous comments swearing that it is true. ==Production== The script for ''QI News'' was written by Meakin and [[Justin Gayner]]. The research for the show was carried out by ''QI'''s "Question Wranglers", [[John Mitchinson (researcher)|John Mitchinson]] and [[Piers Fletcher]], among others. ''QI'''s creator [[John Lloyd (writer)|John Lloyd]] was the [[executive producer]] and it was directed by [[Geoff Posner]]. ==References== {{reflist}} {{QI}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Qi News}} [[Category:QI]] [[Category:Comedy web series]] [[Category:British web series]]

{{Unreferenced|date=May 2008}} {{Infobox Network | network_name = Radio Television Afghanistan
ملی | network_logo = [[File:RTA Afghanistan Logo.svg|250px]] | location_city = [[Kabul]] | country = [[Afghanistan]] | network_type = [[Terrestrial television|Broadcast]] [[radio]], [[television]] and [[Website|online]] | available = National
International  | owner = [[Government of Afghanistan]] | key_people = | founded = 1925 by [[Amanullah Khan]] | motto = | predecessor = | website = http://www.rta.org.af/ }} [[File:Rta radio tv af.jpg|thumb|200px|Previous RTA logo]] [[File:PRT Farah visits Radio Television Afghanistan facility in Farah 130223-N-LR347-102.jpg|thumb|200px|A live regional radio broadcast in [[Farah, Afghanistan|Farah]] in 2013]] '''National Radio Television Afghanistan''' ('''RTA'''; {{lang-ps|د افغانستان ملي راډيو تلويزون}} ''Da Afġanistan Mīlī Radīo Telvizoon'', {{lang-fa|رادیو تلویزیون ملی افغانستان}} ''Rādīo Telvizoon-e Mīlī-e Afġānestān'', branded as '''ملی''' (meaning ''national'')) is the [[public-broadcasting]] organization of [[Afghanistan]], based in [[Kabul]]. This [[governmental]] organ has a national television station ([[Afghanistan National Television]]) and a radio station (Radio Afghanistan). Radio Afghanistan started with [[Radio Kabul]] in 1925 (1304 by the [[Iranian calendar]]), during the era of King [[Amanullah Khan]]. Two radio transmitters with the capacity of 400 watt were procured from the German company of [[Telefunken]], one of those has been installed on Koti Londoni near the bridge of Artel {{Citation needed|date=August 2011}} which subsequently started to its operation and the second one had been transferred to [[Kandahar]] which on that period the musical programs and news were only being broadcast for few hours. Radio Television Afghanistan has regional sub-stations for all [[Provinces of Afghanistan]] which operate radio services, and in some provinces, basic television at a provincial level. They broadcast material produced at provincial level, interspersed with news bulletins distributed by the Kabul-based news desk. These stations are usually closely affiliated with the Provincial Governors' Offices. Broadcast content includes high volumes of government messaging. ==See also== * [[KAF Radio]] ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.rta.org.af/}} [[Category:Media in Afghanistan]] [[Category:Pashto media]] [[Category:Pashto-language television stations]] [[Category:Persian-language television stations]] [[Category:Multilingual broadcasters|Afghanistan]] [[Category:Television channels and stations established in 1974]] [[Category:Radio stations established in 1925]]

revision.text:
'''Richeut''' is the earliest known [[fabliau]], dating from 1159.<ref>{{cite book |last=Cuddon |first=John Anthony |author2=Claire Preston |title=The Penguin Dictionary of Literary Terms and Literary Theory |publisher=Penguin |year=1999 |edition=4 |page=301 |chapter=Fabliau |isbn=978-0-14-051363-9}}</ref>
Although ''Richeut'' shares many of the same characteristics as other fabliaux, it has several unique features: 1. It mentions the outcome of a sexual encounter. 2. It breaks the taboo of incest. 3. It is unusually long, containing 1019 lines. 4. It does not use octosyllables, but a tailrhyme strophe. 5. It has character development. 6. The characters of Richeut and Herselot, the maid, exist outside of this text.<ref>Vernet, André. “Fragments d’un Moniage Richeut?” ''Études de langue et de littérature du Moyen Âge: offertes à Felix Lecoy par ses collègues, ses élèves et ses amis''. Paris: Champion, 1973, pp. 585-597.</ref>
==Summary== This tale recounts the life of a prostitute who uses men to her advantage. She does not discriminate between classes, for she dupes a nobleman, a bourgeois and a clergyman into believing that they are the father of her son, whom she conceived on purpose because she felt that they were no longer paying her enough attention. All three men lavish her and her son with gifts to the point of ruining themselves. Her son, Samson, grows up with all of the privileges that money can buy. Bored by his surroundings, he boasts to his mother that his education is complete for he can easily lead any woman into his bed and, subsequently, into the whorehouse. His mother ridicules him and warns him of the treacherous ways of women. Slighted, Samson claims that no woman will ever make a fool of him and heads out into the world. Along his journeys, he conquers women of all nations and cheats men at dice, even becoming a monk at [[Clairvaux Abbey]] for a brief period of time. After twelve years of deflowering, pimping and dicing, he returns to his mother's hometown. Although he does not recognize her, she knows him and sets out to prove wrong his last boast to her. She tricks him into believing that Herselot, her faithful servant, is a young virgin whom he could never convince to go to bed with him. Intent upon proving her incorrect, he sets out to triumph over the unconquerable and believes to have succeeded. During the act however, he discovers that she is no more a virgin than he is. In the meantime, Richeut convinces seven men of her acquaintance to beat her son, but not kill him. Before Samson can leave Herselot's bed, the men beat him with Richeut intervening, pretending to save him from these men. His boast of twelve years earlier has thus been proven wrong.<ref>Horton, Ingrid D. ''Engendering Vice: The Exemplarity of the Old French Fabliaux''. Diss. U. of Kansas, 2007. Ann Arbor: UMI, 2008.</ref>
== References == {{Reflist}}
==Further reading== *Haddad, Gabriel. "Richeut: A Translation." ''Comitatus: A Journal of Medieval and Renaissance Studies'' 22(1991): 1-29. http://escholarship.org/uc/item/5kh424fc. *Keller, Hans-Erich. “Richeut ou la lutte éternelle entre les sexes.” ''“Por le soie amisté”: Essays in Honor of Norris J. Lacy''. Ed. Keith Busby and Catherine Jones. Amsterdam: Éditions Rodopi, 2000, pp. 247–255. *''Richeut''. Ed. and intro. Philippe Vernay. Bern: Éditions Francke, 1988.
[[Category:Medieval French literature]] [[Category:Fabliaux]]

page.title: Ruyi's Royal Love in the Palace

revision.text:
{{Infobox television | show_name = Ruyi's Royal Love in the Palace | image = Ruyi_Royal_Love.jpg | caption = | show_name_2 = The Legend of Ruyi | native_name = {{Infobox name module | traditional = 如懿傳 | simplified = 如懿传 | pinyin = Rúyì Zhuàn }} | genre = {{ubl|[[Historical fiction]]|[[Romance film|Romance]]}} | based_on = {{based on|''Hou Gong Ru Yi Zhuan''|Liu Lianzi}} | writer = [[Wu Xuelan|Liu Lianzi]] | director = Wang Jun | starring = {{ubl|[[Zhou Xun]]||[[Wallace Huo]]}} | voices = | opentheme = | endtheme = | composer = | country = China | language = Mandarin | num_seasons = 1 | num_episodes = 87 | executive_producer = Huang Lan | editor = | location = {{ubl|[[Hengdian World Studios]]|[[Beijing]]|Wulan Butong|[[Mudu]]}} | cinematography = | company = [http://www.ncmchina.com/# New Classics Media] | channel = [[Tencent Video|Tencent]] | picture_format = | audio_format = | first_run = China | first_aired = {{Start date|2018|8|20}} | last_aired = {{End date|2018|10|15}} | preceded_by = | followed_by = | related = | website = | website_title = | production_website = | production_website_title = }} '''''Ruyi's Royal Love in the Palace''''' ({{zh|c=如懿传|p=Rúyì Zhuàn}}) is a 2018 Chinese television series that chronicles the marriage of [[Qianlong Emperor]] and [[Hoifa-Nara, the Step Empress]]. Starring [[Zhou Xun]] and [[Wallace Huo]], the series is based on novel ''Hou Gong Ru Yi Zhuan'' by [[Wu Xuelan|Liu Lianzi]], and is the sequel to the critically acclaimed drama ''[[Empresses in the Palace]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.shanghaidaily.com/metro/Ruyis-Royal-Love-in-the-Palace-starts-shooting/shdaily.shtml|title='Ruyi's Royal Love in the Palace' starts shooting|date=August 23, 2016|work=[[Shanghai Daily]]}}{{cite web|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/culture/2017-03/05/content_28439763.htm|title=New stills of 'Ruyi's Royal Love in the Palace' released|date=May 3, 2017|work=[[China Daily]]}}{{cite web|url=http://www.womenofchina.cn/womenofchina/html1/news/celebrity/1705/798-1.htm|title=Star-studded TV Drama Gears Up for Small Screen|date=May 5, 2017|work=Women of China}} It airs on [[Tencent Video]] starting August 20, 2018.{{cite web|url=http://ent.qq.com/a/20180816/055960.htm|title=《如懿传》8月20日腾讯视频全网独播 周一至周四每天两集|date=August 16, 2018|website=Tencent|language=zh}}{{cite web|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/201808/17/WS5b763a37a310add14f386560.html|title=New costume drama generating buzz|date=August 17, 2018|website=China Daily}}{{cite web|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/201808/21/WS5b7bd049a310add14f386f97.html|title=TV series on royal romances hits screen|date=August 21, 2018|website=China Daily}}
From 27 November 2018 , it airs on [[Fox Asia|Fox Taiwan]] at 9:00 PM from Monday to Friday For First Episode, and Thereafter at 8:00PM For Two Episode. Despite receiving mixed reviews, the series eventually won acclaim for its exquisite props, lavish sets and stellar cast and has a score of 7.4 points on [[Douban]].{{cite web|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/201809/13/WS5b99aa6fa31033b4f4655ba5.html|title=Drama queen|date=September 13, 2018|website=China Daily}} ==Synopsis== With the Ula Nara clan in disgrace after Empress Yixiu falls out of favour, Ruyi ([[Zhou Xun]]) learns the politics of the harem and steadily climbs up the ranks to become Empress. Even after surviving through multiple conspiracies and successfully proving her innocence, her relationship with Qianlong ([[Wallace Huo]]) had become irreparable. Ruyi eventually becomes disillusioned with her husband and the harsh reality of life in the Palace. Although the love and trust between them gradually disappeared, Ruyi serves as a distinguished empress until her death. ==Cast== ===Main=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:14%"|Actor !! style="width:20%"|Character !! style="width:14%"|Residence !! Introduction |- || [[Zhou Xun]] || [[Hoifa-Nara, the Step Empress|Ula Nara Ruyi]] (乌拉那拉·如懿) || Yanxi Palace
Yikun Palace || '''The Step Empress'''
Lady Qing (Ce fujin) → Consort Xian → Noble Lady Xian → Commoner → Consort Xian → Noble Consort Xian → Imperial Noble Consort → Empress
One of Qianlong's secondary wives, Ruyi was his childhood friend and lover. Unfortunately, the Ula Nara family's reputation affected her standing in the palace, and she was only granted the position of a consort. She survived the inner palace machinations through her strength and determination, as well as with the help of her close friends, and rose up the ranks to become empress. |- | [[Wallace Huo]] || [[Qianlong Emperor|Aisin Gioro Hongli]] (爱新觉罗·弘历) || Prince Bao Manor
Yangxin Palace || '''Qianlong Emperor'''
Prince Bao of the First Rank → Qianlong Emperor
Fourth son of the [[Yongzheng Emperor]], who had a strained relationship with his foster mother Zhenhuan, the Empress Dowager Niohuru. A selfish and insecure ruler; his suspicious nature caused him to become distrustful of Ruyi despite her love for him. |} ===Supporting=== ====The Harem==== {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:14%"|Actor !! style="width:20%"|Character !! style="width:14%"|Residence !! Introduction |- | '''[[Janine Chang]]'''{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2016-08-05/doc-ifxutfpc4557786.shtml|title=《如懿传》张钧甯入主后宫首演清宫戏|date=August 5, 2016|website=Sina|language=zh}}{{cite web|url=http://slide.ent.sina.com.cn/tv/slide_4_704_246690.html#p=1|title=《如懿传》曝张钧甯朝服海报 气质温婉尽显恬静秀丽|date=November 2, 2017|website=Sina|language=zh}} || '''[[Noble Consort Yu|Keliyete Hailan]] (珂里叶特·海兰)''' | Xianfu Palace
Yanxi Palace |'''Noble Consort Yu'''
Embroidery Lady → Lady Hai (Shu fujin) → First Class Female Attendant Hai → Noble Lady Hai → Concubine Yu → Consort Yu → Noble Consort Yu (posthumous)
Hailan was initially an embroidery lady in Qianlong's residence, until Ruyi helped her gain the title of Mistress. Gentle yet determined, she is a loyal friend and confidante of Ruyi. The mother of [[Yongqi, Prince Rong|Yongqi]], the Emperor's favorite son, Hailan is an exceptionally influential consort in the harem; which she made use of to deal with the consorts who stand in Ruyi's way. |- |'''[[Dong Jie]]'''{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-03-03/doc-ifyazwha3701926.shtml|title=董洁《如懿传》剧照曝光 演绎不一样的孝贤纯皇后|date=March 3, 2017|website=Sina|language=zh}} || '''[[Empress Xiaoxianchun|Fuca Langhua]] (富察·琅嬅)''' |Changchun Palace |'''Empress Xiaoxianchun'''
Di fujin → Empress
Elegant and dignified, Langhua was a respected and virtuous Empress who served her role well. However, despite this, she envied Ruyi and her intimate relationship with the Emperor. Under the manipulations of Jin Yuyan, she became embroiled in the inner palace conflicts and collaborated with Gao Xiyue to harm Ruyi.
Her misguided actions eventually caused her relationship with the Emperor to deteriorate, and she died a grievanced woman. |- | '''[[Xin Zhilei]]'''{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-11-02/doc-ifynmzrs6064589.shtml|title=《如懿传》曝朝服海报 辛芷蕾美艳霸气表演传神|date=November 2, 2017|website=Sina|language=zh}} || '''[[Imperial Noble Consort Shujia|Jin Yuyan/Kim Ok Yeon]] (金玉妍/김옥연)''' |Qixiang Palace |'''Imperial Noble Consort Shujia'''
Lady Jin (Shu fujin) → Noble Lady Jia → Concubine Jia → Consort Jia → Noble Consort Jia → Noble Lady Jia → Concubine Jia → Second Class Female Attendant Jin → Noble Consort Jia → Commoner → Imperial Noble Consort Shujia (posthumous)
An orphan that was taken in by a [[Joseon]] minister, Yuyan's main goal in life is to earn the Emperor's favor and bring honor to her tribe and to assist her real love, the "young master" who became the King of Joseon. Manipulative, cunning and shrewd, she is skilled in instigating conflicts between the concubines and is the main culprit behind many of the concubines’ deaths.
Her evil deeds were eventually revealed, and Qianlong granted her the posthumous title of Imperial Noble Consort Shujia (homophone of loser). |- | '''[[Tong Yao]]'''{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-11-01/doc-ifynhhaz1232245.shtml|title=《如懿传》朝服海报曝光 童瑶双眸似水端庄大气|date=November 1, 2017|website=Sina|language=zh}} || '''[[Imperial Noble Consort Huixian|Gao Xiyue]] (高晞月)''' |Xianfu Palace |'''Imperial Noble Consort Huixian'''
Lady Gao (Ce fujin) → Noble Consort Hui → Imperial Noble Consort
Due to her father's position as a highly ranked officer, Xiyue is arrogant and defiant. She hated Ruyi and chose to submit to the more powerful Empress Fuca, collaborating with her to plot against Ruyi. Due to her naivety, she was often goaded by the Empress' attendant, Sulian to commit many evil deeds in place of the Empress.
Xiyue was discarded by Langhua after she lost the Emperor's favour, and then discovered that the Empress was the one who caused her to be infertile. On her death bed, she exposed Langhua's evil deeds to Qianlong. |- |'''[[Li Chun (actress)|Li Chun]]'''{{cite web|url=http://ent.qq.com/a/20171030/028699.htm|title=《如懿传》发布皇家威仪海报 李纯演绎最戏剧性反派|date=October 30, 2017|website=Tencent|language=zh}} || '''[[Empress Xiaoyichun|Wei Yanwan]] (卫嬿婉)''' |Yongshou Palace |'''Empress Xiaoyichun'''
Palace maid → Second Class Female Attendant Wei → First Class Female Attendant Wei → Noble Lady Ling → Concubine Ling → Consort Ling → Second Class Female Attendant Wei → Noble Consort Ling → Imperial Noble Consort → Empress (posthumous)
Yanwan was born a noble lady of the Yellow Banner, but was reduced to being a palace maid after her father was tried for treason. Her first love was Ling Yunche, but she abandoned him after Qianlong took notice of her (due to her close resemblance with Ruyi). Ambitious, cruel and treacherous, she sees Ruyi as her biggest foe, and would resort to all kinds of underhanded methods to climb up the ranks. Yanwan is responsible for the death of many imperial consorts, children, and Ruyi's ultimate demise.
Eventually, her evil deeds and past relationship with Ling Yunche were exposed to Qianlong, and she was poisoned to death. |- | '''[[Hu Ke (actress)|Hu Ke]]'''{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2016-09-23/doc-ifxwevmf2008883.shtml|title=《如懿传》再曝阵容 陈冲李沁胡可等入宫|date=September 23, 2016|website=Sina|language=zh}} || '''[[Imperial Noble Consort Chunhui|Su Lüyun]] (苏绿筠)''' |Zhongcui Palace |'''Imperial Noble Consort Chunhui'''
Lady Su (Shu fujin) → Concubine Chun → Consort Chun → Noble Consort Chun → Imperial Noble Consort
A naive woman who treated everyone with kindness, and was manipulated often. She loved her son dearly, and would do anything for him. She has a good relationship with Ruyi and Hailan since their days in Prince Bao Manor.
Lüyun lost Qianlong's favour when he found out she wanted to take the position of Empress for herself. She later died of illness. |- |'''[[He Hongshan]]'''{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-11-03/doc-ifynmzrs6626500.shtml|title=《如懿传》何泓姗曝朝服海报 婉约清丽显古典雅韵|date=November 3, 2017|website=Sina|language=zh}} || '''Bai Ruiji (白蕊姬)''' |Yonghe Palace
Anhua Palace |'''Concubine Mei'''
Musician of South Manor → Second Class Female Attendant Mei → First Class Female Attendant Mei → Noble Lady Mei → Concubine Mei
A yueqin/pipa player hailing from Suzhou, Ruiji was the first woman to be taken into inner palace after Qianlong's ascension. She was actually sent in by Zhenhuan to spy on Qianlong.
After Ruiji lost her child, her health gradually weakened and she eventually lost the Emperor's favor. She was manipulated into thinking her child was killed by Empress Fuca, and was used as a chesspiece by Jin Yuyan to cause the Empress' death.
When her identity was revealed, Ruiji was used as a scapegoat by Qianlong to weaken the Empress Dowager's control of the Harem. She died a grievanced death after realizing she took revenge on the wrong person. |- |'''[[Chen Haoyu]]'''{{cite web|url=http://ent.qq.com/a/20171103/016490.htm#p=1|title=陈昊宇《如懿传》曝海报 气度冷傲内心痴情似火|date=November 3, 2017|website=Tencent|language=zh}} ||'''[[Consort Shu|Yehe Nara Yihuan]] (叶赫那拉·意欢)''' |Chuxiu Palace |'''Consort Shu'''
Noble Lady Shu → Concubine Shu → Consort Shu
A talented lady of noble birth, Yihuan was recommended into the palace by the Empress Dowager. Despite being one of Zhenhuan's chess piece, she fell in love with first sight at Qianlong during one of his outings and is extremely dedicated to him. Straightforward and good-natured, Yihuan keeps herself out of the palace inner conflicts and is good friends with Ruyi.
Unbeknownst to her, Qianlong personally gave her medicine that would prevent her from bearing healthy children due to her affiliation with Zhenhuan. She became mentally unstable after her son died in infancy, and committed suicide soon after knowing Qianlong's true intention. |- |'''Ceng Yixuan'''{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-11-02/doc-ifynmzrs6117684.shtml|title=《如懿传》曝朝服版海报 曾一萱眼神犀利气势夺人|date=November 2, 2017|website=Sina|language=zh}} || '''Socolun Aruo (索绰伦·阿箬)''' |Qixiang Palace |'''Concubine Shen'''
Palace maid of Ruyi → Imperial palace maid → First Class Female Attendant Shen → Noble Lady Shen → Concubine Shen → Commoner
Originally a personal maid that entered Qianlong's residence as part of Ruyi's dowry, she secretly sided with the Empress and Gao Xiyue in an effort to climb up the ranks. Arrogant, superficial and sharp-tongued, she appeared to be favored by Qianlong but was actually used by him as a charade partner.
Aruo was eventually sent to the cold palace and committed suicide there. |- |'''[[Cao Xiwen]]'''{{cite web|url=http://ent.qq.com/a/20171103/027510.htm#p=1|title=《如懿传》曝曹曦文海报 人生赢家温婉不失霸气|date=November 3, 2017|website=Tencent|language=zh}} || '''[[Noble Consort Wan|Chen Wanyin]] (陈婉茵)''' |Zhongcui Palace |'''Noble Consort Wan'''
Shu fujin → Second Class Female Attendant Wan → First Class Female Attendant Wan → Noble Lady Wan → Concubine Wan → Consort Wan → Noble Consort Wan (posthumous)
A timid lady who never formed cliques, and always kept to herself. She was not favoured, and chose to express her love for the Emperor through drawings. She has a good relationship with Ruyi. She unknowingly played a part in Qianlong and Ruyi's separation due to Wei Yanwan's manipulations. |- |'''Zhang Jianing''' || '''[[Noble Consort Ying|Barin Meiruo]] (巴林·湄若)''' |Chuxiu Palace |'''Noble Consort Ying'''
Concubine Ying → Consort Ying → Noble Consort Ying
A spirited young lady who is of royal Mongol descent, and is described as the “Southern beauty” by Qianlong. She despised Wei Yanwan and Jin Yuyan, and ended up becoming good friends with Ruyi. |- |Liu Meitong{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-11-03/doc-ifynnnsc4536139.shtml|title=《如懿传》曝朝服海报 刘美彤身穿高挑直率仗义|date=November 3, 2017|website=Sina|language=zh}} || Bai'ergesi Kezhuzi (拜尔噶斯·恪朱紫) |Xianfu Palace |'''Concubine Ke'''
Noble Lady Ke → Concubine Ke
A descendant of Mongolian royalty. She is close to Barin Meiruo and disliked Wei Yanwan. |- |[[Li Qin (actress)|Li Qin]]{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-11-01/doc-ifynhhaz1072073.shtml|title=《如懿传》曝李沁朝服版剧照 清冷孤傲气场十足|date=November 1, 2017|website=Sina|language=zh}} ||[[Fragrant Concubine|Han Xiangjian]] (寒香见) |Chengqian Palace
Baoyue Lobby |'''Consort Rong'''
Noble Lady Rong → Concubine Rong → Consort Rong
A beautiful woman who was taken into the palace by General Zhaohui after her tribe was conquered by the Qing Dynasty. Xiangjian's only goal was to assassinate Qianlong in order to take revenge for her lover. She is on good terms with Ruyi, whom she is grateful toward. |- |Yu Yang || [[Imperial Noble Consort Qinggong|Lu Muping]] (陆沐萍) |Jingyang Palace |'''Imperial Noble Consort Qinggong'''
First Class Female Attendant Qing → Noble Lady Qing → Concubine Qing → Noble Lady Qing → Concubine Qing → Consort Qing → Noble Consort Qing → Imperial Noble Consort Qinggong (posthumous)
A daughter of the Deputy Minister from the Court of Sacrificial Worship, she was sent in by the Empress Dowager and acts as her spy.
She was set-up by the Emperor, causing her to lose the ability to bear a child. After falling out of favor, she chose to submit to Wei Yanwan. |- |Han Dantong{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-03-03/doc-ifyazwha3692260.shtml|title=《如懿传》韩丹彤饰黄绮莹 一路心机侍女变贵人|date=March 3, 2017|website=Sina|language=zh}} || Huang Qiying (黄琦莹) |Jingyang Palace
Yanxi Palace |'''Concubine Yi'''
Personal maid of Langhua → Shu fujin → Noble Lady Yi → Concubine Yi (posthumous)
Originally a maid under Langhua, she was promoted to the position of Mistress after Qianlong took advantage of her.
Langhua and Xiyue despised Qiying for stealing the Emperor's affections, and caused her to miscarry. She was manipulated into believing that Ruyi was the culprit, and attempted to assassinate the latter when they were living in the same quarters. |- |Zhao Ke || Borjigit Eyinzhu (博尔济吉特·厄音珠) |Yonghe Palace |'''Consort Yu'''
Concubine Yu → Consort Yu
A descendant of Mongolian royalty, and an early favourite of Qianlong. However, later to earn the Emperor's favor, she started coming up with lies, including framing Ruyi of having an affair with Ling Yunche.
She was sent to the torture chambers after she was found to have lied about Ruyi and Ling Yunche's affair. |- |Jiang Ruijia{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2016-12-06/doc-ifxyiayq2528365.shtml|title=姜瑞佳加盟《如懿传》 所饰角色形似如懿|date=December 6, 2016|website=Sina|language=zh}} || [[Consort Dun|Wang Fuzhi]] (汪芙芷) |Chengqian Palace
Yikun Palace |'''Consort Dun'''
Palace maid → First Class Female Attendant Dun → Noble Lady Dun → Concubine Dun → Consort Dun
Originally a maid that worked in the palace garden, she entered the palace after Qianlong took notice of her while taking a walk. She is favored due to her resemblance with Ruyi and Wei Yanwan. |- | Sun Wenting || Lady Lin (林氏) |Jingren Palace |'''Noble Lady Gong'''
First Class Female Attendant Gong → Noble Lady Gong
A lady of Mongol descent. She is close to Barin Meiruo, and hates Wei Yanwan. |- |Wang Mian || Lady Sirin Gioro (西林覺羅氏) || Jingren Palace || '''First Class Female Attendant Xi''' |- | Zhao Ruoxi || Xiu Liqin (秀丽琴) || Jingyang Palace

Foster mother of Qianlong Emperor.
Although she appeared to share a civil relationship with Qianlong, they are wary and suspicious of each other. Imperial guards, physicians and others |- | '''Jing Chao'''{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-03-02/doc-ifycaasy7312934.shtml|title=《如懿传》曝凌云彻剧照 经超演绎英武冷宫侍卫|date=March 2, 2017|website=Sina|language=zh}} || '''Ling Yunche (凌云彻)''' || {{NA}} || Imperial guard of the cold palace → Imperial guard of Kunning Palace → Royal Lanling Imperial guard → Royal Imperial guard of 3rd rank → Slave → Royal imperial guard of 2nd rank → Royal imperial guard of 1st rank → Eunuch of Yikun Palace
Wei Yanwan's first love, Miaoqing's husband.
A loyal and empathetic man who helped Ruyi while she was banished to the cold palace. He gradually becomes attracted to Ruyi, and helped her through her most difficult times in the palace. He is later accused of having an affair with Ruyi, castrated and subsequently ordered to serve in Ruyi's palace as a form of humiliation. He was killed by Hailan when the latter realized he would pose a threat to Ruyi's position as the Empress. |- | '''[[Yuan Wenkang]]''' || '''Jiang Yubin (江与彬)''' || {{NA}} || An imperial physician.
He is Suoxin's childhood sweetheart and later husband. |- | Meng Zhaozhong || Zhao Jiuxiao (趙九霄) || Kunning Palace || An imperial guard.

He secretly worked for the Empress Dowager behind Qianlong's back, causing Qianlong to be infuriated. web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-10-24/doc-ifymzzpw1144230.shtml|title=流潋紫：在周迅之前 《如懿传》曾被很多人拒绝|date=October 24, 2017|website=Sina|language=zh}} The series also employed [[William Chang]] and 2016|work=ifeng|language=zh}} Han Zhong as art director and Peng Xuejun as cinematography director.{{cite web|url=http://pic.people.com.cn/n1/2016/0824/c1016-28661008.html|title=《如懿传》昨天开机 times to achieve the best version in the next five years.{{cite news|author= |url=http://epaper.cz001.com.cn/site1/czwb/html/2016-01/18/content_921330.htm |script-title=zh:《如懿传》周迅要演清宫“娘娘”（有图） |newspaper=CZ |date=January 18, 2016 |language=zh}} [http://www.ncmchina.com/# New Classics Media] picked up the series for a 90-episode season (later shortened to 87), and each episode cost approximately S$1.95 million, making it the most expensive television series in China.{{cite web|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/lifestyle/entertainment/chinese-palace-drama-starring-zhou-xun-sells-online-rights-for-record-s195|title=Chinese palace drama starring Zhou Xun sells online rights for record S$1.95 million per episode|date=January 27, 2016|work=[[The Straits Times]]}} ===Casting=== On January 14, 2016, it was announced that [[Zhou Xun]] will play the leading role of [[Hoifa-Nara, the Step Empress]].{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/s/2016-01-14/doc-ifxnrahr8290923.shtml|title=《如懿传》将拍 周迅担任女主首入清宫|date=January 14, 2016|website=Sina|language=zh}} The role of [[Qianlong Emperor]], the male lead, was announced to be portrayed by [[Wallace Huo]] on May 27.{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2016-05-27/doc-ifxsqxxs7795189.shtml|title=霍建华确认加盟《如懿传》与周迅搭档|date=May 27, 2016|website=Sina|language=zh}} On August 3, actors [[Janine Chang]], [[Vivian Wu]], [[Dong Jie]], [[Tong Yao]], Jing Chao, [[Xin Zhilei]], [[Li Chun (actress)|Li Chun]], Zeng Yixuan and Chen Haoyu were cast in lead roles for the drama.{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2016-08-03/doc-ifxunyya3197171.shtml|title=《如懿传》公布演员名单 董洁张钧甯在列|date=August 3, 2016|website=Sina|language=zh}} Around 5,000 actors competed for roles in the drama.{{cite web|url=http://ent.huanqiu.com/article/2016-08/9352550.html|title=《如懿传》5千演员选角 霍建华听5次历史知识讲座|date=August 24, 2016|website=Huanqiu|language=zh}} ===Filming=== Shooting began on 23 August 2016 and took place in various locations including [[Hengdian World Studios]], [[Beijing]], [[Inner Mongolia]], and [[Hangzhou]].{{cite news|author= |url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2016-08-23/doc-ifxvcsrn9015429.shtml?from=wap |script-title=zh:《如懿传》曝开机照 周迅霍建华帝后聚首 |newspaper=[[Sina Corp|Sina]] |date=August 23, 2016 |language=zh}} The series wrapped up filming on May 5, 2017.{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-05-06/doc-ifyeychk7077144.shtml|title=董洁《如懿传》杀青难掩不舍 与周迅"相爱相杀"|date=May 5, 2017|work=[[Sina Corp|Sina]]|language=zh}} Ref. |- |rowspan=2|24th [[Huading Awards]] |Best Director |Wang Jun |{{nom}} |rowspan=2|{{cite web|url=http://ent.163.com/18/1022/11/DUNIG0DK000380EO.html|title=华鼎奖提名公布 《和平饭店》《归去来》闪耀榜单|date=October 22, 2018|website=Netease|language=zh}} |- | Best Actor |[[Wallace Huo]] |{{nom}} |- |} ==International broadcast== On 10 June 2016, [[Fox Networks Group|Fox Networks Group Asia]] (FNG) and Turner Broadcasting System Asia has acquired global rights outside mainland China to the series.{{cite news|author= |url=https://variety.com/2016/tv/asia/fox-networks-boards-china-series-ruyis-love-in-the-palace-1201793549/ |title= Fox Networks Boards Chinese Series ‘Ruyi’s Love in the Palace’|newspaper=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=June 11, 2016|language= }} It is the first epic period drama secured by FNG for markets outside China, and it will be carried by [[STAR Chinese Channel]] (SCC), the flagship Chinese general entertainment channel, It's Starting August 20, 2018 at 9:00PM (Start Showing Delay 1 Hours) in Selection Countries.{{cite news|author= |url=http://www.casbaa.com/news/member-news/fox-networks-group-asia-acquires-exclusive-rights-to-ruyis-love-in-the-palace/ |title=Fox Networks Group Asia acquires exclusive rights to Ruyi’s Love in the Palace |newspaper= casbaa.com|date=June 10, 2016 |language= }}

{{nofootnotes|date = February 2017}} {{Listen |title=Troopers Tribunal (1905) |filename=U.S. Air Force Band - Henry Fillmore - Troopers Tribunal.ogg |description=[[Henry Fillmore]]'s ''Troopers Tribunal'', a [[circus march]] for which Fillmore used a punning name – troupers, as in a circus troupe – in order to conceal whom he wrote the march for from his conservative father.<ref>[http://www.usafband.af.mil/ensembles/BandDiscography.asp?albumID=38 Liner notes to Front & Center, a Collection of American Marches], U.S. Air Force Band</ref> }}
A '''screamer''' is a descriptive name for a [[circus]] [[March (music)|march]], in particular, an upbeat march intended to stir up the audience during the show.
== History == Screamers were mostly composed in a 60-year period (1895–1955). Circuses were in need of music that would stir the audience into a frenzy, as four-footed animals galloped across the ring. Because march music was a prominent part of American music at that time, and because it carried such a quick tempo, it was this that ringmasters demanded.
== Musicality == {{listen |filename=The Circus Bee.ogg |title=The Circus Bee |description=Fillmore's "[[The Circus Bee]]" performed by the [[United States Marine Corps Band]] |filetype=[[Ogg]] |filename2=RollingThunder (USAFB).ogg |title2=Rolling Thunder |description2=Fillmore's "[[Rolling Thunder (march)|Rolling Thunder]]" performed by the Ceremonial Brass of the United States Air Force |filetype2=[[Ogg]] }} Circus marches are faster than a normal military march, often 130 to 150 beats/minute.
Although screamers tend to follow the march form, many times they are abbreviated, and additions, such as a quick cornet call introduction to a new [[melody]], are included. A typical screamer lasts a minute to three and a half minutes.
Screamers are a very demanding type of music, due to their extremely fast and advanced rhythms, especially the low-brass parts. Double and even triple [[tonguing]] is often required in order to play these rhythms. The trio in "[[The Melody Shop]]" is a good example of this.
Many screamers have [[Counterpoint|two prominent melodies playing at once]]. Although this is not unusual in a march, screamers tend to go further with this. The low-brass section can be playing a long, stately melody, while the [[woodwind]]s can be moving along with a phrase of 16th notes, or vice versa.
Due to the circumstances in which screamers are played, dynamics tend to stay at a level forte. Unlike some military marches, [[Dynamics (music)|piano]] is rarely used.
== Composers == The most prominent composer of circus marches is [[Karl King|Karl L. King]], most notably with his march "Barnum & Bailey's Favorite". Other screamer composers include [[Fred Jewell]] and [[Henry Fillmore]]. [[John Philip Sousa]] wrote "On Parade" and a few others, but his writing in the circus march style is not renowned.

King]] * ''Bennett's Triumphal'' by [[Melvin H. Ribble]] * ''The Big Cage'' by [[Karl L. King]] * ''[[The Billboard March]]'' by [[John N. Klohr]] * ''Bombasto'' by [[Orion R. Farrar]] * ''Bones Trombone'' by [[Henry Fillmore]] * ''Bravura'' by [[Charles E. Hughes]] * ''Circus King'' by [[Charles E. Duble]] * ''Coat of Arms'' by [[George Kenny]] * ''Floto's Triumph'' by [[Fred Jewell]] * ''His Honor'' by [[Henry Fillmore]] * ''Invictus'' by [[Karl L. King]] * ''Klaxon'' by [[Henry Fillmore]] * ''[[The Melody Shop]]'' by [[Karl L. King]] * ''Onward and Upward'' by [[Edwin Franko Goldman]] * ''Robinson's Grand Entree'' by [[Karl L.
