{{short description|Australian entertainers}} {{Use Australian English|date=October 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2018}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = The Janoskians | image = Janoskians.jpg | image_size = 305 | caption = The Janoskians appearing at a meet and greet session in [[Liverpool, New South Wales]], June 2012. From left to right: [[#Members|Daniel Sahyounie]], [[#Members|Beau Brooks]], [[#Members|Luke Brooks]], [[#Members|Jai Brooks]], [[#Members|James Yammouni]] | background = group_or_band <!-- This is an infobox parameter, please don't change it. --> | origin = [[Melbourne]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], [[Australia]] | genre = [[Pop music]] | years_active = 2011–present | label = [[Republic Records]] since March 2014,<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.republicrecords.com/big-news-janoskians-partnered-republic-crazy/ |title=Archived copy |access-date=13 January 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160324063431/http://www.republicrecords.com/big-news-janoskians-partnered-republic-crazy/ |archive-date=24 March 2016 |dead-url=no}}</ref> previously [[Sony Music Australia]] | current_members = {{Unbulleted list|[[#Members|Beau Brooks]] | [[#Members|Jai Brooks]] | [[#Members|Luke Brooks]] | [[#Members|Daniel Sahyounie]]}} | past_members = [[#Former members|James Yammouni]] | associated_acts = | website = {{URL|the-janoskians.com}} }}
'''The Janoskians''' ('''J'''ust '''a'''nother '''n'''ame '''o'''f '''s'''illy '''k'''ids '''i'''n '''a'''nother '''n'''ation)<ref name="youtube.com">{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/user/Janoskians |title=Janoskians |via=YouTube |access-date=11 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170308091653/https://www.youtube.com/user/Janoskians |archive-date=8 March 2017 |dead-url=no}}</ref> are a [[YouTube]] [[comedians|comedy]] group from [[Melbourne]], [[Australia]], The group consists of elder brother Beau Brooks, twins Luke and Jai Brooks, and friend Daniel Sahyounie. James Yammouni left in 2016.
The Janoskians have avid fans known as 'Janoskianators'. Their videos include performing gross out humor and non-consensual pranks on members of the public as well as each other, [[mockumentary|mockumentaries]], dares and [[Sketch comedy|skits]].
== Group members == All original five members were born in [[Melbourne]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], [[Australia]]. Three of them are brothers: Beau the eldest, Luke and Jai are twins, they met Daniel and James at school. Beau and Daniel finished high school but James, Luke and Jai dropped out to focus on the group.
The group consists of: * Beau Peter Brooks, born {{birth date and age|df=yes|1993|7|31}}, the oldest of the Brooks Brothers. Beau is commonly known as the front man for their music, with many professions including singing, modelling and acting. * Luke Anthony-Mark Brooks, born {{birth date and age|df=yes|1995|5|3}}, elder twin to Jai Brooks. Luke is also a singer in the group. * Jaidon "Jai" Domenic-Matthew Brooks, born {{birth date and age|df=yes|1995|5|3}}, younger twin and brother to Luke and Beau Brooks. Similarly to his brothers, he is a singer in the group. * Daniel John-Richard Sahyounie, also known as "Skip", born {{birth date and age|df=yes|1994|10|31}}, a vocalist in the band.
=== Former members === * James Anthony Yammouni, born {{birth date and age|df=yes|1996|2|27}}, a rapper in the group, as well as DJing for the Janoskian shows. He releases yearly megamixes on New Year and presents "The James Yammouni Show" on YouNow. He left in 2016.<ref name="twitter.com">{{cite web |url=https://twitter.com/janoskians/status/744608293167857664 |title=Janoskians on Twitter |access-date=20 June 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180724175418/https://twitter.com/janoskians/status/744608293167857664 |archive-date=24 July 2018 |dead-url=no}}{{Primary source inline|date=July 2018}}</ref>
== Career ==
=== 2011: Beginnings and breakthrough === {{Expand section|more details|date=April 2015}} The Janoskians began their YouTube channel in July 2011.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Malpass |first1=Luke |title=The silly dozen: Australia's top 12 YouTube sites |url=https://www.afr.com/technology/social-media/youtube/the-silly-dozen-australias-top-12-youtube-sites-20150126-12ybs6 |accessdate=13 July 2018 |work=[[The Australian Financial Review]] |date=30 January 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180713135910/https://www.afr.com/technology/social-media/youtube/the-silly-dozen-australias-top-12-youtube-sites-20150126-12ybs6 |archive-date=13 July 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref> They posted their first video in September 2011 for their friends to have a laugh at, and one month later they gained 100,000 subscribers. They were featured on ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show|Ellen]]''{{'s}} ''Dance Dares'' segment, after [[Scooter Braun]] tweeted [[Ellen Degeneres]] with the Janoskians attempt.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vPi2cn_8-a4 |title=Ellen's Dance Dare |last=Janoskians |date=4 March 2012 |via=YouTube |access-date=11 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180502211437/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vPi2cn_8-a4 |archive-date=2 May 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
They appeared in the music video for "Forget the World" by Australian singer [[Faydee]] on 14 August 2012, pulling off some of their typical stunts in a classroom setting.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=24XBbny0--k |title=Faydee – Forget The World (FML) [Official Music Video] |last=faydeetv |date=3 July 2012 |via=YouTube |access-date=4 August 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150601074542/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=24XBbny0--k |archive-date=1 June 2015 |dead-url=no}}</ref> Jai Brooks also appeared in the music video of another one of Faydee's songs titled "Can't Let Go" on 9 October 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N_YcD_yESk8 |title=Faydee – Can't Let Go (Official Video) |last=faydeetv |date=9 October 2013 |via=YouTube |access-date=4 August 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150809003937/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N_YcD_yESk8 |archive-date=9 August 2015 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
=== 2012–2013: International success === On 31 March 2012, the group scheduled a [[meet and greet]] with their fans at Melbourne's [[Luna Park, Melbourne|Luna Park]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.facebook.com/events/247346155361033/ |title=Janoskians Meet and Greet! |website=''facebook.com'' |access-date=11 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180724175418/https://www.facebook.com/events/247346155361033/ |archive-date=24 July 2018 |dead-url=no}}{{Primary source inline|date=July 2018}}</ref> The event had to be cancelled when unexpectedly large crowds turned up.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Lowe |first1=Adrian |title=No meet, no greet: Janoskians fans sent home |url=https://www.theage.com.au/national/victoria/no-meet-no-greet-janoskians-fans-sent-home-20120402-1w7mq.html |accessdate=13 July 2018 |work=[[The Age]] |date=2 April 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180615214310/https://www.theage.com.au/national/victoria/no-meet-no-greet-janoskians-fans-sent-home-20120402-1w7mq.html |archive-date=15 June 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Midena |first1=Kate |title=Cyber celebs shut down Luna Park. But who on earth are they? |url=https://www.news.com.au/entertainment/cyber-celebs-shut-down-luna-park-but-who-on-earth-are-they/news-story/f77072b97a64b0b5921c76e5b940265d |accessdate=13 July 2018 |publisher=[[News.com.au]] |date=2 April 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180713135559/https://www.news.com.au/entertainment/cyber-celebs-shut-down-luna-park-but-who-on-earth-are-they/news-story/f77072b97a64b0b5921c76e5b940265d |archive-date=13 July 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref> Whilst in [[Perth]], Western Australia, the group scheduled a meet and greet event at [[Westfield Whitford City]] shopping centre on 7 July 2012. The event attracted 3,000 teenagers, who met the group and obtained autographs. Many fans arrived early and camped out to ensure they had a chance to meet the members.
In 2012, the Janoskians signed a contract with [[Sony Music Australia]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/entertainment/video-pranks-pay-off-for-the-janoskians-as-they-sign-deal-with-sony/story-e6frf96f-1226426232397 |title=Video pranks pay off for The Janoskians as they sign deal with Sony |author=Luke Dennehy |work=Sunday Herald Sun |date=15 July 2012}}</ref> Their first single, "Set This World on Fire",<ref>{{cite news |title=The Janoskians talk love, life and their new single 'Set This World On Fire' |url=http://www.dolly.com.au/celebrity/the-janoskians-talk-love-life-and-their-new-single-set-this-world-on-fire-6113 |accessdate=13 July 2018 |work=[[Dolly (magazine)|Dolly]] |date=4 October 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180713135419/http://www.dolly.com.au/celebrity/the-janoskians-talk-love-life-and-their-new-single-set-this-world-on-fire-6113 |archive-date=13 July 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref> co-written by Beau Brooks, was released on iTunes on 18 September 2012 on iTunes.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Vout |first1=Elise |title=The Janoskians release debut single! |url=http://www.mtv.com.au/the-janoskians-mtv-sessions/news/the-janoskians-release-debut-single |accessdate=13 July 2018 |publisher=MTV |date=19 September 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180713150103/http://www.mtv.com.au/the-janoskians-mtv-sessions/news/the-janoskians-release-debut-single |archive-date=13 July 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref><!-- first as an audio file<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BYgnbtpKXZI |title=The Janoskians – Set This World On Fire (Lyric Video) |last=JanoskiansVEVO |date=20 September 2012 |via=YouTube}}</ref>, --> An "unofficial" music video was released on 25 September,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XXKHgxkEHnY |title=Set This World On Fire – MUSIC VIDEO (UNOFFICIAL) |last=Janoskians |date=25 September 2012 |via=YouTube |access-date=30 November 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160729221932/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XXKHgxkEHnY |archive-date=29 July 2016 |dead-url=no}}</ref> followed by an official music video<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TIYXmQAyMm0 |title=The Janoskians – Set This World On Fire |last=JanoskiansVEVO |date=8 October 2012 |via=YouTube |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160419015712/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TIYXmQAyMm0 |archive-date=19 April 2016 |dead-url=no}}</ref> on 8 October. The group later released five more music videos, taken from each of the members' perspectives.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KKmwq9mU_vA |title=The Janoskians – Set This World On Fire – Beau's Janoskian's Cam |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121125181630/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KKmwq9mU_vA&gl=US&hl=en |archive-date=25 November 2012 |dead-url=no}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pzRbzdE-XXY |title=The Janoskians – Set This World On Fire – Luke's Janoskian's Cam |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140806123840/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pzRbzdE-XXY |archive-date=6 August 2014 |dead-url=no}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j-_ltel0XLg |title=The Janoskians – Set This World On Fire – James Janoskian's Cam |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160402031902/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j-_ltel0XLg |archive-date=2 April 2016 |dead-url=no}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZsUfNBVw7b0 |title=The Janoskians – Set This World On Fire – Daniel's Janoskian's Cam |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140915210202/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZsUfNBVw7b0 |archive-date=15 September 2014 |dead-url=no}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fYo7V4tR_uI |title=The Janoskians – Set This World On Fire – Jai's Janoskian's Cam |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140915210149/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fYo7V4tR_uI |archive-date=15 September 2014 |dead-url=no}}</ref> The Janoskians encouraged their fans to create their own videos for the song.
In late 2012, the group produced an eight-episode web show for [[MTV Australia]] titled ''The Janoskians: MTV Sessions''.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Alpe |first1=Lauren |title=Introducing 'The Janoskians: MTV Sessions'! |url=http://www.mtv.com.au/the-janoskians-mtv-sessions/news/introducing-the-janoskians-mtv-sessions |accessdate=13 July 2018 |publisher=[[MTV]] |date=8 October 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180713150346/http://www.mtv.com.au/the-janoskians-mtv-sessions/news/introducing-the-janoskians-mtv-sessions |archive-date=13 July 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref> The show was posted to MTV Australia's website over an 8-week period, but is now available on Youtube to watch on "MTV International" Channel.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u6J7f9qGWzQ&list=PL7EeDFH0wHlA1KFg7JWYRcPlw-P6gvnjH |title=The Janoskians Promo – MTV Sessions – MTV |last=MTV International |date=14 December 2012 |via=YouTube |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180724175418/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u6J7f9qGWzQ&list=PL7EeDFH0wHlA1KFg7JWYRcPlw-P6gvnjH |archive-date=24 July 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
The Janoskians had their first charting hit in 2012 with "Set This World on Fire" peaking it at number 19 in the Australian Singles Chart,<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?interpret=The+Janoskians&titel=Set+This+World+On+Fire&cat=s |title=Archived copy |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180412212309/http://www.australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?interpret=The+Janoskians&titel=Set+This+World+On+Fire&cat=s |archive-date=12 April 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref> and also made it to Top 30 in New Zealand<ref>{{cite web |url=http://charts.org.nz/showitem.asp?interpret=The+Janoskians&titel=Set+This+World+On+Fire&cat=s |title=charts.org.nz – The Janoskians – Set This World On Fire |first=Steffen |last=Hung |website=''charts.org.nz'' |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180413043223/http://charts.org.nz/showitem.asp?interpret=The+Janoskians&titel=Set+This+World+On+Fire&cat=s |archive-date=13 April 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref> and Top 100 in the UK.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.officialcharts.com/search/singles/set-this-world-on-fire/ |title=set this world on fire – full Official Chart History – Official Charts Company |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180412212206/http://www.officialcharts.com/search/singles/set-this-world-on-fire/ |archive-date=12 April 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref> The follow up single "Best Friends" reached number 30 in Australia, and also charted in New Zealand,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://top40-charts.com/song.php?sid=36167&sort=chartid |title=Janoskians – Best Friends |website=Top40-Charts.com |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180413043231/http://top40-charts.com/song.php?sid=36167&sort=chartid |archive-date=13 April 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref> the Netherlands and the UK.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.musicvf.com/The+Janoskians.art |title=The Janoskians Songs ••• Top Songs / Chart Singles Discography ••• Music VF, US & UK hits charts |website=''musicvf.com''}}</ref>
The Janoskians had scheduled a meet and greet at the Wet Seal store in the [[Beverly Center]] in Los Angeles on 13 October 2013. The group expected only a few hundred people, but when roughly 7/8 thousand fans arrived, the event was shut down and the mall was evacuated by the police.<ref>{{cite news |last=MacBride |first=Melissa |url=http://abc7.com/archive/9285987/ |title=Beverly Center evacuated after thousands show up to see band |date=13 October 2013 |publisher=ABC News |accessdate=13 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180413192655/http://abc7.com/archive/9285987/ |archive-date=13 April 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
=== 2014–2015: EP, Tour, Janofest and Movies === On 22 February 2014, The Janoskians organised a meet-up in Times Square, New York. Expecting around 1,000 fans to turn up but 20,000 fans arrived, hoping to meet the group to get autographs. Police closed off 7th Avenue at 43rd Street for several hours and hustled the group into Foxwoods Theater, leaving the waiting fans disappointed.<ref>{{cite web |author=Kristina Behr |url=http://pix11.com/2014/02/22/thousands-of-teens-shut-down-times-square-to-see-australian-pranksters-the-janoskians/ |title=Thousands of teens shut down Times Square to see Australian pranksters |publisher=Pix11.com |date=22 February 2014 |accessdate=9 March 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140307050227/http://pix11.com/2014/02/22/thousands-of-teens-shut-down-times-square-to-see-australian-pranksters-the-janoskians/ |archive-date=7 March 2014 |dead-url=no}}</ref> [[Lions Gate Entertainment|Lionsgate]] announced in May 2014 that it had signed a deal with The Janoskians for launching a film featuring them called "Public Disturbance", which also features ''[[Mike Tyson]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.deadline.com/2014/05/lionsgate-signs-youtube-pranksters-the-janoskians-to-movie-deal/ |title=Lionsgate Signs YouTube Pranksters The Janoskians To Movie Deal |author=Mike Fleming Jr |publisher=Deadline Hollywood |access-date=29 May 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140529124056/http://www.deadline.com/2014/05/lionsgate-signs-youtube-pranksters-the-janoskians-to-movie-deal/ |archive-date=29 May 2014 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
"This Fuckin Song<ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/this-f-kin-song/900511688?i=900511698 |title=This F**kin Song by The Janoskians |date=29 July 2014 |access-date=11 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180412084111/https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/this-f-kin-song/900511688?i=900511698 |archive-date=12 April 2018 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>" was released along with the music video. A clean radio-friendly version had also been launched retitled "This Freakin Song". Both were released on 29 July 2014 on Republic Records, a division of UMG Recordings. "That's What She Said" was later released on 9 September along with the music video, by Republic Records, a division of UMG Recordings, Inc.
"Got Cake Tour" which was their second tour, It had 35 tour stops all over the UK and North America. The tour started on 29 August in Birmingham and finished on 30 October in Seattle.
On 2 March 2015, they released ''Would U Love Me – EP<ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/would-u-love-me-ep/968518796 |title=Would U Love Me – EP by The Janoskians |date=2 March 2015 |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180413043058/https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/would-u-love-me-ep/968518796 |archive-date=13 April 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref>' which included their four songs 'Would U Love Me', 'Moodswings', 'La Girl' and 'Real Girls Eat Cake'.They released the 'La Girl' music video<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EYHFsZF_usU |title=Janoskians – "LA Girl" [Official Video] |last=Janoskians |date=3 March 2015 |via=YouTube |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151226104913/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EYHFsZF_usU |archive-date=26 December 2015 |dead-url=no}}</ref> the next day on 3 March. The "MoodSwings" music video<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qBgGM69AtpY |title=The Janoskians – MoodSwings |last=JanoskiansVEVO |date=19 March 2015 |via=YouTube |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150331060516/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qBgGM69AtpY |archive-date=31 March 2015 |dead-url=no}}</ref> was released on 19 March and lastly the "Would U Love Me" music video<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l9wvfLby3Mk |title=The Janoskians – Would U Love Me |last=JanoskiansVEVO |date=3 April 2015 |via=YouTube |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170125192154/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l9wvfLby3Mk |archive-date=25 January 2017 |dead-url=no}}</ref> was released on 3 April.
For their JanoFest event on 21 March in Wembley Arena, London for one night only, got sold out and the band released a long single called "Rock Opera" where each member had his own separate contribution on the record. James talked about how he is still the same even though he lost weight, Luke talked about his love for photography, Daniel talked about how people assume that he's dumb, Jai talks about how everyone tells him who to date and Beau talks about how he doesn't like to be called the nice guy.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aFBnC2zPkEU |title=Janoskians – Rock Opera |last=JanoVlog |date=20 March 2015 |via=YouTube |access-date=11 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151208212411/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aFBnC2zPkEU |archive-date=8 December 2015 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
Their single "Friend Zone<ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/friend-zone-single/981982244 |title=Friend Zone – Single by The Janoskians |date=7 April 2015 |access-date=11 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180412084113/https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/friend-zone-single/981982244 |archive-date=12 April 2018 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>" was released on 7 April 2015 along with the music video<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5ZL64DgWpW0 |title=The Janoskians – Friend Zone |last=JanoskiansVEVO |date=30 April 2015 |via=YouTube |access-date=11 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151212153601/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5ZL64DgWpW0 |archive-date=12 December 2015 |dead-url=no}}</ref> where they dressed up as zombies, and later released a public prank being zombies.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ST-JFm2M2Ns&t=72s |title=ZOMBIE PRANK! |last=Janoskians |date=15 May 2015 |via=YouTube |access-date=11 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180724175418/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ST-JFm2M2Ns&t=72s |archive-date=24 July 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
On 28 August they released their first movie "Janoskians Untold & Untrue" ,it is available to watch on Netflix and only has good reviews.<ref>https://www.netflix.com/browse/genre/100048?jbv=80094058&jbp=0&jbr=0</ref> They were invited to go on the red carpet with there new movie. Beau, Luke and Jai's mum Gina Brooks and Daniels brother surprised the boys at the event, the boys though they were at home in Australia.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g4HJ_LyHg78 |title=Our Families Surprise Us at Our Movie Premiere |last=JanoVlog |date=31 August 2015 |via=YouTube}}</ref>
"Jahoo Jahaa Tour" which is now their third tour covered The UK, Europe, America & Australia. With 22 dates around The UK and Europe, started in Dublin on 29 August and ended in Athens on 26 September.
On 2 November their new single "Teenage Desperate<ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/teenage-desperate-single/1053974507 |title=Teenage Desperate – Single by The Janoskians |date=2 November 2015 |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180412220314/https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/teenage-desperate-single/1053974507 |archive-date=12 April 2018 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>" was released, and the music video<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u9lnXFS8Au8 |title=Janoskians – "Teenage Desperate" [Official Video] |last=Janoskians |date=12 November 2015 |via=YouTube |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160302015655/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u9lnXFS8Au8 |archive-date=2 March 2016 |dead-url=no}}</ref> later released on 12 November. On 17 December another single "All I Want 4 Christmas<ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/all-i-want-4-christmas/1068239440?i=1068239624 |title=All I Want 4 Christmas by The Janoskians |date=17 December 2015 |access-date=12 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180412213244/https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/all-i-want-4-christmas/1068239440?i=1068239624 |archive-date=12 April 2018 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>" was released.
=== 2016–2017: Another Fail Tour, More Music === On 4 April 2016 a new single "Love What You Have<ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/love-what-you-have/1098760797?i=1098760935 |title=Love What You Have by The Janoskians |date=4 April 2016 |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180413185822/https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/love-what-you-have/1098760797?i=1098760935 |archive-date=13 April 2018 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>" was released.
Their "Another Fail Tour" was around North America then headed to The UK and Europe, with the first date in San Diego on 26 August and the last date in [[Kraków]] on 28 October 2016.
"One More Time<ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/one-more-time/1190346538?i=1190346586 |title=One More Time by The Janoskians |date=9 January 2017 |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180414011842/https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/one-more-time/1190346538?i=1190346586 |archive-date=14 April 2018 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>" was a single released on 9 January 2017 and they released a music video<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rVaaAJbJV8g |title=One More Time – Janoskians (Official Music Video) |last=Janoskians |date=28 January 2017 |via=YouTube |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180724175418/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rVaaAJbJV8g |archive-date=24 July 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref> on 28 January 2017 which is shot on a camping trip with them and their friends. On 10 May 2017 they released a new single "All The Things<ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/album/all-the-things/id1237358735?i=1237358740&v0=9990&ign-mpt=uo=1 |title=All the Things by Janoskians |date=10 May 2017 |access-date=24 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180713110551/https://itunes.apple.com/album/all-the-things/id1237358735?i=1237358740&v0=9990&ign-mpt=uo%3D1 |archive-date=13 July 2018 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>", they then released the lyric video<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=INI_tMyjuAw |title=All The Things (Lyric Video) |last=JanoVlog |date=18 May 2017 |via=YouTube |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180724175418/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=INI_tMyjuAw |archive-date=24 July 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref> on 18 May on their seconds channel 'JanoVlog<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCRl0RTgrRo3AdY-jKD-NZg |title=JanoVlog |via=YouTube |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170122192126/https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCRl0RTgrRo3AdY-jKD-NZg |archive-date=22 January 2017 |dead-url=no}}</ref>' and also released a homemade style music video<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lxxdTGbwjzE |title=All The Things – Janoskians (OFFICIAL MUSIC VIDEO) |last=Janoskians |date=22 May 2017 |via=YouTube |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180724175418/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lxxdTGbwjzE |archive-date=24 July 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref> on 22 May on their main channel.<ref name="youtube.com" />
On 9 June The Janoskians twitter account announced that James had left the group.
Their follow up single on 1 August 2017 was "Enough<ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/enough/1259727903?i=1259728248 |title=Enough by Janoskians |date=1 August 2017 |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180413190024/https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/enough/1259727903?i=1259728248 |archive-date=13 April 2018 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>" and later released a music video<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e245sqB227g |title='Enough' Official Music Video (The Janoskians) 2018 |last=Janoskians |date=23 February 2018 |via=YouTube}}</ref> for it on 23 February on their main channel.<ref name="youtube.com" /> On 29 September they released another single "Oceans<ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/oceans-single/1283326208 |title=Oceans – Single by The Janoskians & Trifo |date=29 September 2017 |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180413190159/https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/oceans-single/1283326208 |archive-date=13 April 2018 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>" which featured an Australian DJ Trifo.
=== 2018: Music, Merch and Public Disturbance === On 7 March 2018 their new single "Fuck Up<ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/f-k-up/1356860315?i=1356860316 |title=F**k Up by Janoskians |date=7 March 2018 |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180413190156/https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/f-k-up/1356860315?i=1356860316 |archive-date=13 April 2018 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>" was accidentally released as it was originally meant to be released later in the month. On 23 March they released a line of Janoskians merchandise,<ref name="crispytees.com">{{cite web |url=https://crispytees.com/collections/janoskians |title=Janoskians |website=CrispyTees |access-date=11 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180412082620/https://crispytees.com/collections/janoskians |archive-date=12 April 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref> including t-shirts and hoodies and a onesie. On 4 April they released the first episode of their new series "AW PAUL"<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T7Bk7r0ttJc |title=AW PAUL – OBLIVIOUS (EP 1) |last=Janoskians |date=4 April 2018 |via=YouTube}}</ref> on their YouTube channel. On the 11 & 12 May they join [[HRVY]] on his tour. On August 28 Public Disturbance was released on iTunes
== Online popularity and tours == [[File:Janoskians (7319001460).jpg|thumb|left|A group of teenage fans waiting for The Janoskians at an appearance in Sydney]] As of February 2015, the group's YouTube channel has over 1.8 million subscribers. Aside from their original and main channel, "Janoskians<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCx6Rp6KfbLK1ro6bWLnI40g |title=Janoskians |via=YouTube |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180208022817/https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCx6Rp6KfbLK1ro6bWLnI40g |archive-date=8 February 2018 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>," they have three additional channels where they regularly post videos: "JanoVlog<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/user/JanoskiansBlog |title=JanoVlog |via=YouTube |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160608095947/https://www.youtube.com/user/JanoskiansBlog |archive-date=8 June 2016 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>," "DareSundays<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/user/daresundays |title=daresundays |via=YouTube |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160425010840/https://www.youtube.com/user/daresundays |archive-date=25 April 2016 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>," and "TwinTalkTime<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/user/TwinTalkTime |title=TwinTalkTime |via=YouTube |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160425132340/https://www.youtube.com/user/TwinTalkTime |archive-date=25 April 2016 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>." The Janoskians also credit [[Twitter]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://twitter.com/janoskians?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor |title=Janoskians (@janoskians) |publisher=Twitter}}{{Primary source inline|date=July 2018}}</ref> and [[Facebook]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://en-gb.facebook.com/Janoskians/ |title=Janoskians |website=en-gb.facebook.com}}</ref> for their success; Each member of the group has over a million followers on Twitter, and all of them use it, along with Facebook, to regularly and directly interact with their fans.
Their first video was uploaded in September 2011.,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f2u_O2E2oQM&t=48s |title=Break Up To Make Up |last=Janoskians |date=27 September 2011 |via=YouTube |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150522061500/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f2u_O2E2oQM |archive-date=22 May 2015 |dead-url=no}}</ref> and their early videos were initially intended to be a way to show off their pranks to personal friends, but as time went on, they became popular among the general public. In an interview, a member said their video, "Awkward Train Situations<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n4rkVVVJMlc&t=61s |title=Awkward Train Situations – ORIGINAL |last=Janoskians |date=19 October 2012 |via=YouTube |access-date=13 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141108002050/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n4rkVVVJMlc |archive-date=8 November 2014 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}</ref>" was a part of the beginning of their, "kick-off" launch as a label.<ref name="TimeOut">{{cite web |url=http://www.au.timeout.com/melbourne/timein/features/2369/the-janoskians |title=The Janoskians interview |publisher=TimeOut Melbourne |date=8 February 2013 |accessdate=22 January 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140829070204/http://www.au.timeout.com/melbourne/timein/features/2369/the-janoskians |archive-date=29 August 2014 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
The Janoskians offer material on [[social networking service]]s and are commonly the subject of [[fanfiction]].<ref name="theage.com.au">{{cite news |author=Adrian Lowe |url=http://www.theage.com.au/victoria/no-meet-no-greet-janoskians-fans-sent-home-20120402-1w7mq.html |title=No meet, no greet: Janoskians fans sent home from Luna Park |work=The Age |date=16 February 2012 |accessdate=12 June 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130610020127/http://www.theage.com.au/victoria/no-meet-no-greet-janoskians-fans-sent-home-20120402-1w7mq.html |archive-date=10 June 2013 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
The Janoskians have completed three world tours in 2013, 2014 and 2016, as well as a sold out one-off Janofest show at [[Wembley Arena]], [[London]] in 2015. They appeared in the 28th Annual Kids Choice Awards, where they had body painted suits.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/janoskians-wear-tuxedos-designed-body-6265287 |title=The Janoskians think outside the box with body paint tuxedos |first=Edward |last=Roberts |date=17 August 2015 |access-date=11 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180412082847/https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/janoskians-wear-tuxedos-designed-body-6265287 |archive-date=12 April 2018 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
== Criticism == The Janoskians have been criticised for their reckless, dangerous and juvenile behaviour, and pushing their boundaries too far.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/police-called-in-after-clash-between-pranksters-the-janoskians-and-facebeef-at-federation-square/story-e6frf7jo-1226563598313 |title=Police called in after clash between pranksters The Janoskians and Facebeef at Federation Square |accessdate=13 August 2014 |date=29 January 2013 |work=[[Herald Sun]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140825211601/http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/police-called-in-after-clash-between-pranksters-the-janoskians-and-facebeef-at-federation-square/story-e6frf7jo-1226563598313 |archive-date=25 August 2014 |dead-url=no}}</ref> [[Media commentator]] Prue MacSween stated that, "Their act – if you can call it that – is so juvenile, and I think really irresponsible. It's astounding the power of the internet now. It just tells you that this global audience can be viral and suddenly nobodies with very little talent can suddenly be known by the world." The group has been criticised for pulling "disgusting pranks on strangers" and for engaging in "sleazy, offensive and intimidating" behaviour around babies and women.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/entertainment/the-janoskians-slammed-over-repulsive-video/story-fni0b7je-1226658087578 |title=The Janoskians under fire for sick baby skit |accessdate=13 August 2014 |date=6 June 2013 |work=[[Herald Sun]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160307092608/http://www.heraldsun.com.au/entertainment/the-janoskians-slammed-over-repulsive-video/story-fni0b7je-1226658087578 |archive-date=7 March 2016 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
== Dirty Pig Clothing == They had their own clothing line known as Dirty Pig Clothing. The line came to an end in early 2017. But they now have a new range of merchandise out.<ref name="crispytees.com" />

{{about|the 1958 film written and directed by Ingmar Bergman|other uses|The Magician (disambiguation)}} {{missing information|the film's production and theatrical/home media releases|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox film | name = The Magician | image = The-Magician-poster.jpg | caption = Film poster | director = [[Ingmar Bergman]] | producer = [[Allan Ekelund]] | writer = [[Ingmar Bergman]] | starring = [[Ingrid Thulin]]
[[Max von Sydow]]
[[Naima Wifstrand]]
[[Gunnar Björnstrand]]
[[Bengt Ekerot]]
[[Bibi Andersson]]
[[Erland Josephson]] | music = [[Erik Nordgren]] | cinematography = [[Gunnar Fischer]] | editing = [[Oscar Rosander]] | distributor = [[AB Svensk Filmindustri]] | released = 26 December 1958 | runtime = 107 minutes | country = Sweden | language = Swedish | budget = | gross = }} '''''Ansiktet''''' (Swedish "The Face") is a [[1958 in film|1958]] [[Swedish language|Swedish]] film written and directed by [[Ingmar Bergman]]. It was released theatrically as ''The Face'' in the [[United Kingdom]], although video releases have used the U.S. title ''The Magician''. The film stars [[Max von Sydow]] as a traveling magician named Albert Vogler. Reading reports of a variety of supernatural disturbances at Vogler's prior performances abroad, the leading townspeople request that Vogler's troupe provide them a sample of their act, before allowing them public audiences. The scientifically minded disbelievers try to expose them as charlatans, but Vogler has a few tricks up his sleeve. The film was distantly inspired by [[G. K. Chesterton]]'s play ''Magic'', which Bergman numbered among his favourites. Bergman staged a theatre production of "''Magic''" in [[Swedish language|Swedish]] at one point.{{Citation needed|date=March 2008}} The film was selected as the Swedish entry for the [[Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film|Best Foreign Language Film]] at the [[31st Academy Awards]], but was not accepted as a nominee.Margaret Herrick Library, Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences ==Plot== {{no plot|date=March 2018}} ==Cast== * [[Max von Sydow]] – Albert Emanuel Vogler * [[Ingrid Thulin]] – Manda Vogler (alias Mr. Aman) * [[Gunnar Björnstrand]] – Dr. Vergerus, Minister of Health * [[Naima Wifstrand]] – Granny Vogler * [[Bengt Ekerot]] – Johan Spegel * [[Bibi Andersson]] – Sara * [[Birgitta Pettersson]] - Sanna * [[Gertrud Fridh]] – Ottilia Egerman * [[Lars Ekborg]] – Simson, the coach driver * [[Toivo Pawlo]] – Police Superintendent Starbeck * [[Erland Josephson]] – Consul Egerman * [[Åke Fridell]] – Tubal * [[Sif Ruud]] – Sofia Garp * [[Oscar Ljung]] – Antonsson, burly stableman * [[Ulla Sjöblom]] – Henrietta Starbeck * [[Axel Düberg]] – Rustan, young manservant ==Reception== {{expand section|date=October 2017}} ''The Magician'' has a [[List of films with a 100% rating on Rotten Tomatoes|unanimous approval rating]] on [[Rotten Tomatoes]]. Don Druker of the ''[[Chicago Reader]]'' called it "one of Bergman's most tightly structured and frightening films."{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/1013065-magician/ |title=The Magician (1958) |publisher=Rotten Tomatoes |accessdate=January 17, 2017}} Author and film critic [[Leonard Maltin]] awarded the film three out of four stars, calling it "A thoughtful (and too-long underrated) portrait of a man who is part-faker, part-genius."{{cite book|author1=Leonard Maltin|author2=Spencer Green|author3=Rob Edelman|title=Leonard Maltin's Classic Movie Guide|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=hLtaAAAAYAAJ|date=January 2010|publisher=Plume|isbn=978-0-452-29577-3|page=402}} [[Woody Allen]] selected ''The Magician'' as one of the five Bergman films that he would most recommend to those unfamiliar with the filmmaker.{{cite magazine|url=http://content.time.com/time/arts/article/0,8599,1648917,00.html|title=Woody Allen on Ingmar [[File:Type of triads-2.png|thumb|right|300px|''Types of triads'': {{audio|Major triad on C.mid|I}}, {{audio|Minor triad on C.mid|i}}, {{audio|Diminished triad on C.mid|i{{music|diminished}}}}, {{audio|Augmented triad on C.mid|I<sup>+</sup>}}]]
In [[music]], a '''triad''' is a set of three notes (or "[[pitch class|pitch classes]]") that can be stacked vertically in thirds.<ref name="Pen">Ronald Pen, ''Introduction to Music'' (New York: McGraw-Hill, 1992): 81. {{ISBN|0-07-038068-6}}. "A triad is a set of notes consisting of three notes built on successive intervals of a third. A triad can be constructed upon any note by adding alternating notes drawn from the scale. ... In each case the note that forms the foundation pitch is called the ''root'', the middle tone of the triad is designated the ''third'' (because it is separated by the interval of a third from the root), and the top tone is referred to as the ''fifth'' (because it is a fifth away from the root)."</ref> The term "harmonic triad" was coined by [[Johannes Lippius]] in his ''Synopsis musicae novae'' (1612).
When stacked in thirds, notes produce triads. The triad's members, from lowest-pitched tone to highest, are called:<ref name="Pen"/>
* the '''root''' * the '''third''' – its interval above the root being a [[minor third]] (three semitones) or a [[major third]] (four semitones) * the '''fifth''' – its interval above the third being a minor third or a major third, hence its interval above the root being a [[diminished fifth]] (six semitones), [[perfect fifth]] (seven semitones), or [[augmented fifth]] (eight semitones). Perfect fifths are the most commonly used interval above the root in Western [[Classical music|classical]], [[popular music|popular]] and [[traditional music]].
(Note: The notes of a triad do not have to use the root as the lowest note of the triad, due to the principle of [[Inverted chord|inversion]]. A triad can also use the third or fifth as the lowest note of the triad. Inverting a triad does not change the root note.)
Some twentieth-century theorists, notably [[Howard Hanson]]<ref>Howard Hanson, ''Harmonic Materials of Modern Music: Resources of the Tempered Scale'' (New York: Appleton-Century-Crofts, 1960).</ref> and [[Carlton Gamer]],<ref>Carlton Gamer, "Some Combinational Resources of Equal-Tempered Systems", ''Journal of Music Theory'' 11, no. 1 (1967): 37, 46, 50–52.</ref> expand the term to refer to any combination of three different pitches, regardless of the intervals amongst them. The word used by other theorists for this more general concept is "triad".<ref>Julien Rushton, "Triad", ''The New Grove Dictionary of Music and Musicians'', second edition, edited by [[Stanley Sadie]] and [[John Tyrrell (musicologist)|John Tyrrell]] (London: Macmillan Publishers, 2001).</ref> Others, notably [[Allen Forte]], use the term to refer to combinations apparently stacked of other intervals, as in "[[Quartal and quintal harmony|quartal]] triad".<ref>Allen Forte, ''[https://books.google.com/books/about/The_Structure_of_Atonal_Music.html?id=j9aV2JYHY4AC The Structure of Atonal Music]'' (New Haven and London: Yale University Press, 1973): {{Page needed|date=February 2014}}<!--Electronic search of GoogleBooks scan finds only one use of "triad" (in "diminished triad") and no occurrence of "quartal". Of course, the GoogleBooks search function may not be complete.--> {{ISBN|0-300-02120-8}}.</ref>
In the late [[Renaissance music]] era, and especially during the [[Baroque music]] era (1600–1750), Western art music shifted from a more "horizontal" [[contrapuntal]] approach (in which [[Polyphony|multiple, independent melody lines were interwoven]]) toward [[Chord progression|progression]]s, which are sequences of triads. The progression approach, which was the foundation of the Baroque-era [[basso continuo]] accompaniment, required a more "vertical" approach, thus relying more heavily on the triad as the basic building block of [[Diatonic function#Functional harmony|functional harmony]].
The root tone of a triad, together with the degree of the scale to which it corresponds, primarily determine a given triad's function. Secondarily, a triad's function is determined by its quality: [[major third|major]], [[minor third|minor]], [[diminished triad|diminished]] or [[augmented triad|augmented]]. Major and minor triads are the most commonly used triad qualities in Western [[classical music|classical]], [[popular music|popular]] and [[traditional music]]. In standard [[tonal music]], only major and minor triads can be used as a [[tonic (music)|tonic]] in a song or some other piece of music. That is, a song or other vocal or instrumental piece can be in the key of C major or A minor, but a song or some other piece cannot be in the key of B diminished or F augmented (although songs or other pieces might include these triads within the triad progression, typically in a [[Passing triad|temporary, passing role]]). Three of these four kinds of triads are found in the major (or diatonic) scale. In popular music and 18th-century classical music, major and minor triads are considered to be [[consonance (music)|consonant]] and stable, and diminished and augmented triads are considered to be [[dissonance (music)|dissonant]] and unstable.{{Citation needed|date=November 2016}}
{{quote|When we consider musical works we find that the triad is ever-present and that the interpolated [[dissonance (music)|dissonances]] have no other purpose than to effect the continuous variation of the triad.|[[Lorenz Mizler]] (1739)<ref>Allen Forte, ''Tonal Harmony in Concept and Practice'', third edition (New York: Holt, Rinehart and Winston, 1979): 136. {{ISBN|0-03-020756-8}}.</ref>}}
==Construction== Triads (or any other [[tertian]] triads) are built by superimposing ''every other'' note of a [[Diatonic|diatonic scale]] (e.g., standard major or minor scale). For example, a C major triad uses the notes C–E–G. This spells a triad by ''skipping over'' D and F. While the interval from each note to the one above it is a third, the quality of those thirds varies depending on the quality of the triad: *''major'' triads contain a major third and perfect fifth interval, symbolized: R 3 5 (or 0–4–7 as semitones) {{Audio|Major triad on C.mid|play}} *''minor'' triads contain a minor third, and perfect fifth, symbolized: R {{music|flat}}3 5 (or 0–3–7) {{Audio|Minor triad on C.mid|play}} *''diminished'' triads contain a minor third, and diminished fifth, symbolized: R {{music|flat}}3 {{music|flat}}5 (or 0–3–6) {{Audio|Diminished triad on C.mid|play}} *''augmented'' triads contain a major third, and augmented fifth, symbolized: R 3 {{music|sharp}}5 (or 0–4–8) {{Audio|Augmented triad on C.mid|play}}
The above definitions spell out the interval of each note above the root. Since triads are constructed of stacked thirds, they can be alternatively defined as follows: * ''major'' triads contain a major third with a minor third stacked above it, e.g., in the major triad C–E–G (C major), the interval C–E is major third and E–G is a minor third. * ''minor'' triads contain a minor third with a major third stacked above it, e.g., in the minor triad A–C–E (A minor), A–C is a minor third and C–E is a major third. * ''diminished'' triads contain two minor thirds stacked, e.g., B–D–F (B diminished) * ''augmented'' triads contain two major thirds stacked, e.g., D–F{{Music|sharp}}–A{{Music|sharp}} (D augmented).
==Function== [[File:Primary triads in C.png|thumb|Primary triads in C {{audio|Primary triads in C.mid|Play}}.]] Each triad found in a diatonic (single-scale-based) key corresponds to a particular [[diatonic function]]. Functional harmony tends to rely heavily on the [[primary triad]]s: triads built on the [[tonic (music)|tonic]], [[subdominant]] (typically the ii or IV triad), and [[dominant (music)|dominant]] (typically the V triad) degrees.<ref name="Harrison">Daniel Harrison, ''Harmonic Function in Chromatic Music: A Renewed Dualist Theory and an Account of its Precedents'' (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1994): 45. {{ISBN|0-226-31808-7}}. Cited on p. 274 of Deborah Rifkin, "A Theory of Motives for Prokofiev's Music", ''Music Theory Spectrum'' 26, no. 2 (2004): 265–289.</ref> The roots of these triads begin on the first, fourth, and fifth degrees (respectively) of the diatonic scale, otherwise symbolized: I, IV, and V (respectively). Primary triads, "express [[diatonic function|function]] clearly and unambiguously."<ref name="Harrison"/> The other triads of the diatonic key include the [[supertonic]], [[mediant (music)|mediant]], [[submediant]], and [[subtonic]], whose roots begin on the second, third, sixth, and seventh degrees (respectively) of the diatonic scale, otherwise symbolized: ii, iii, vi, and vii{{music|diminished}} (respectively). They function as auxiliary or supportive triads to the primary triads.
